mowl.graph.node2vec¶

mowl.graph.node2vec.model¶

class mowl.graph.node2vec.model.Node2Vec(edgelist, p, q, num_walks, walk_length, embeddings_file_path, dimensions=128, window_size=10, workers=8, iter=1, is_directed=False, is_weighted=False, data_root='.')¶

Bases: object

Reference implementation of node2vec.

Original author: Aditya Grover

For more details, refer to the paper: node2vec: Scalable Feature Learning for Networks Aditya Grover and Jure Leskovec Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD), 2016

Adapted by Sonja Katz, 2021

alias_draw(J, q)¶

Draw sample from a non-uniform discrete distribution using alias sampling.

alias_setup(probs)¶

Compute utility lists for non-uniform sampling from discrete distributions. Refer to https://hips.seas.harvard.edu/blog/2013/03/03/the-alias-method-efficient-sampling-with-many-discrete-outcomes/ for details

get_alias_edge(G, src, dst)¶

Get the alias edge setup lists for a given edge.

learn_embeddings(walks)¶

Learn embeddings by optimizing the Skipgram objective using SGD.

node2vec_walk(walk_length, start_node)¶

Simulate a random walk starting from start node.

preprocess_transition_probs(G)¶

Preprocessing of transition probabilities for guiding the random walks.

read_graph()¶

Reads the input network in networkx.

simulate_walks(num_walks, walk_length)¶

Repeatedly simulate random walks from each node.

train()¶

Notes¶

asdmfwes

Examples¶

safjwoepf
